ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] PUT: does the server may modify the origin entity sent by the client?
ygData.msgSnippet: hello jakob. ... absolutely! any non-trivial server will do that for many server-controlled things such as modification date or other kinds of book-keeping.

hello jakob.

On Dec 21, 2011, at 12:29, "Jakob Strauch" <jakob.strauch@web=
.de> wrote:
> If a client sends an entity to be replaced (PUT), does the se=
rver may interfere with the entity and e.g. add hypermedia links or set/com=
plete additional content? He could answer the request with the modified ver=
sion...

absolutely! any non-trivial server will do that for many server-co=
ntrolled things such as modification date or other kinds of book-keeping.

=
cheers,

dret.
